The fries are not what I like, (I'm real picky about fries, if you see my very short "Fries" list) and what does it matter, though they are fresh (Not frozen)!  The Salad dressing was good, not great (I'm very picky about EVERYTHING!!!)!

Then I had the Chicken Gyro with two sides of Tzatziki. Excellent!  The music was soft Greek sounding, relaxing, great dining music!  The Decor is Greek: Blue and White.  Very comfortable environment!

The service was Outstanding!  Superb!  Top Notch!!! Fast and Friendly!  Had lunch there today and they were busy and handling it with Skill!!!

Fantastik!  Beats the jopps off of the Greek Competition and Competes well with ALL Mediterranean Nations represented in the Area AND that is NOT an easy thing!  Believe me, I used to live here and I used to live only a mile from this spot!

Winner Tzatziki Sauce Category KussKuss Awards 2017 Charlotte

Generous Portions of Meat and Delicious!  This is the BEST Addition to this Neighborhood in 13 years!!!  I still KNOW!!!!

Peasants Salad the way you like it!  The WAY I like it for sure!  NO Lettuce!  All the good stuff with no filler!

Brief Menu = Specialized

Authentic. Fast. Quality was delivered. Awesome food with optional kids plates. I can't wait to eat there again. Bring your appetite, everything on the menu sounds fantastic and the aroma is mouthwatering.

I have been eating at Greco regularly for 3 years now and have been delighted during each visit.
My kids loooove their chicken skewers with the tasting Greek seasoning. (They beg me to take them there).
You can't leave without indulging in the lemon oregano fries. I dare to say they are the best fries in the state! Only get one order for the table though; as the portion is ample and you WILL clean your plate.
The tzatiki is so creamy and light...I always get extras.
Mmmmmm, I am hungry remembering the lamb burger on pita; wow...I call that happiness on a plate.
Greek salad and shrimp pita are just some of my other favorites.
Oh, I almost forgot the prices are so reasonable for the quality and if you want extra tzatiki, they don't nickel and dime you; they happily give you more with a smile.
And they are family owned; very nice people.
Gotta go; I need me some Greco love.
Always good food and excellent service.  They really care about their customers and go the extra mile.  Love the falafel, lemon Basil frys, and gyro.  All their food is awesome and fresh!

Mr. H says he liked their Gyro best in Charlotte area, to date.  Mrs. H., a french-fry fanatic, enjoyed their plain fries the best.  (She tried plain and lemon-herb, side-by-side).  The hummus is a decent, home-made variety, but is on the pasty side.

One down-fall, this place uses a "Wonder Bread" version of a pita bread.  It's no-where near authentic, and it's pretty dough-y.  That, by itself, drops from 5-star experience.
Lamb gyro and cumin & garlic fries were awesome. Didn't have room for baklava, but it looked yummy. Definitely will be back.
Love this place! Good healthy choices at good prices and nice fast service. Nick the owner is always so friendly and knows his regulars!

The best Greek place in town!!! The chicken gyro is my favorite with a side of fries flavored with Rosemary and lemon zest.

Treat yourself to a bakalava for dessert!

The food has sadly Americanized, too much success too soon?
I've been back a few times  - not as often as I'd like because 22 miles is a long round trip for a Gyro - the fun has been going down but today, finally was just a big disappointing. 

They no longer offer the delicious Melitzonasalata, I was told because locals are not interested. Galaktompureko sorry no we don't have any, I didn't see any spinach pie ... it's pretty much down to people lining up for Gyro and "Greek" fries. 

Even the gyro (which is still good) is not what it used to be - more grease, less flavor ... is that pressed lamb meat? Not the same.

I brought home the Lahano salad, which turned out to be nothing but shredded cabbage with a tiny bit of Arugula, essentially $7 for a plate of slaw. Studying the menu after the fact I see I was supposed to spend an  additional $3-$4 for chicken or some other protein on top, Greek salad? I think not.  

If enough people notice maybe the owners will raise their standards but I won't be holding my breath.

Very good Greek food. Probably the best in the area (South Charlotte). I had the traditional gyro. My wife had the chicken gyro. Both were excellent. Employees are awesome. Friendly and quick.  Can't wait to go back!

I come for the fries. Some of the best pub style fries in Charlotte. Different hummus every day. Generous portions. WiFi is password protected but they'll happily give you the current password at the register.
Yes! The lamb in the gyro is so good. Pairs nicely with fresh toppings and zippy tzatziki.
Our favorite restaurant in Charlotte!Amazing and inexpensive! The chicken is so good and delicious. Great gyros. You can't go wrong or over order.

They do an unbelievable job here . Can't belie it took me 2 years to give it a try. All the reviews are spot on. Traditional Gyro, cumin garlic fries,, make you wanna slap your momma!  Great job guys keep it up.  Owner is awesome and make sure you are satisfied and happy.

Five Guys doesn't sit well with me after I eat it, so whenever my friends go there, I go next door to Greco and we eat outside at a connected patio.  

I've never had a bad experience here.  It's as simple as can be -- you look at their huge menu as you walk in, order at the counter, and they bring their food to you.  There are pretty good options, although I always get one of their Gyros.  I prefer Chicken to Traditional (lamb), but both are good.  Also, you can make it a combo for about $3 extra. I've gotten their hummus and pita, which was delicious, but I really dig their fries.  They've got 4 flavors -- lemon oregano, cumin and garlic, sea salt, and spicy.  My favorite?  The spicy.  I really want to try their grape leaves next time.

I could go on about the food, but their service is fantastic too.  They're friendly, make good recommendations and serve you with smiles on their faces.  All this makes for a 5-star experience.

Addicting ! Always fresh and delicious. Friendly service. Clean restaurant. My favorite is the shrimp pita with fries. Several hummus flavors to choose from. Fries are delicious. Some of the best I've had in charlotte. Healthy food choices.

Walked in on a weekday afternoon to give this place a second try. I ordered a meal that came with one chicken kebab and fries. My order was to-go and when I opened the box to eat my good, I was quite disappointed to taste the bed of fries to be all burnt. These were surely the worst fries i have ever had in my life. Not sure how this place gets an award for the best fries. If it were to me I would give them the award for the worst and burnt fries.

This is located in the Blakeney shopping center. Ordered the chicken gyro combo, comes with drink and fries for $2.75 more, I think. The gyro is always packed with chicken and really flavorful with the tzatziki sauce. I get the lemon and oregano fries; also yummy. Nice people, good food at a reasonable price.

Great Greek food with a great price point! Don't ever choose Shomars over this place. I've pretty much tried every pita and have never been disappointed. I was surprised how juicy and flavorful their gyro was--not dry at all. The same can be said about their chicken and salmon. I honestly think their shrimp is much better than some seafood restaurants. I've gone to many places where the shrimp was over cooked and rubbery, but that is not the case here. Their portion sizes are pretty big, and their small fries can feed 2-3 people. Come hungry or you'll be leaving with leftovers. 

Not to mention, their staff is friendlu and really helpful if you don't know what to get. John suggested for me to try several new dishes and I was happy with what I got!

Excellent choice for a late lunch early dinner. The Mezza Platter is ample with soft warm pita, hummus,tzatziku dip, feta olives dolmades and spinach pie. Paired with a relaxing tall glass of Cabernet it hit the spot on a late Friday afternoon. No frills, just good food at Greco Fresh!

Always a good spot to grab some Greek lunch including gyros & hummus but I like the veggie pita as well. Friendly staff.. Try it out if you want some different from burgers or tacos; you won't be disappointed.

Amazing food, always awesome customer service, and the restaurant is immaculately clean. The best place in town for great quality, fresh, and healthy food. I have tried a lot of different things on the menu, and I can't complain about a single dish, everything is delicious!

Delicious. 
I always forget about this place but once I remember I want it for like 4 days straight :) 
Hummus is amazing 
Gyro is amazing 
Chicken is amazing 
Spicy fries amazing 
Yum yum oh and adorable

Went to Greco for a quick lunch after school today. Walking in, you notice the sleek decor paired with older Greek decorations. It's an interesting vibe they create, but they pull it off pretty well. I ordered the grilled chicken gyro. We sat outside, and our food was out in about ten minutes. My chicken was very very good. Fresh, and not chewy at all. Probably some of the best chicken I've had. The tzatziki was fresh and delicious, and the onions and tomatoes complimented the whole thing. The pita was also very good.

Service was fine, really not enough interaction to judge anything. Overall, if I was in a bind for time, I'd go again!

Food was good. Outside seating is not well planned. Blocked the entrance to the restaurant. Inside the restaurant you can't breathe for the cooking smoke. Really need a better exhaust system for kitchen.

If there was a 3 1/2 star option, I would choose it. Nice people, prompt service, reasonable prices. Have had chicken kabobs the last three times and unfortunately the chicken can either be great or completely rubbery which, for $10, is a pretty big bummer. Not sure if this is about the quality of chicken they buy or the way it is cooked. Would love for them to figure this out, because I would come more regularly. Greek salad is great.

This place is a must try. The food and service are excellent every trip. We brought our dog with us today to sit outside and the staff immediately brought a water bowl and some treats for her. They are very pet friendly so that is a big plus! We always get the gyros and they never disappoint. I like these better than Showmars and that is saying something. As for sides, the lemon oregano fries are stellar as well as the loukamades. 

If you haven't been you must stop here to try it for yourself.
Lemon-oregano fries! Their fries are our favorite fries in Charlotte! But eat them there, they'll get soggy if you try to take them with you. Love the gyros too. Next time I'm trying the lamb burger.
Delicious and great price! Definitely a nice option in an otherwise expensive shopping center

Yay for Yelp! Was looking for a reasonably priced non-chain and Yelp told me to go here. I did what most of you suggested and got the simple lam gyro and lemon oregano fries combo. About $10 for the combo, which was a little more than I wanted to spend, but it was delicious. The tzatziki sauce with the fries were SO GOOD. Definitely homemade sauce. The gyro tasted really fresh and the lamb was obviously cooked fresh too. I personally like a little feta on my gyro, but that's alright...it may not be traditional Greek to have feta. Nevertheless, high recommended! Will go back soon for sure!

While visiting Charlotte, NC  today we stopped at Greco Fresh Grille. Oh my goodness! The BEST Traditional Gyro I have had.  Flavorful, tender, juicy and the greatest Tzatziki sauce. Family owned. And I must say, a great friendly family they are. We must go back before our trip ends.

Came here on a road trip down from Greensboro. The owner of the place took our order and was incredibly nice. I ordered the Traditional Gyro and my mom the Falafel. 

The gyro was amazing. Everything you want in a lamb gyro, amazingly cooked and they did not skimp on the lamb!

The Falafel was beyond words. I've had Falafel all over the world and this somehow surpassed all of them. 

The owner came over to check on us, and when we told him how amazing it was he told us the secret to making a great Falafel. All in all, amazing staff, amazing food, and amazing experience. There's no way to disappoint here.

Very very good GREEK restaurant and owner is from Greece so knows how it should really taste without the typical pure grease gyros you get at other places. This isn't a fair ground this is great quality GREEK food. Love it - the aura of the place is great too very clean and love the music playing! Five stars!

Today was my second visit to Greco and this review is based on both visits.  Both times I had a regular Gyro and hand-cut fries with lemon and oregano.  

First off the gyro is very tasty and filling.  Good portion of lamb and the house-made Tzatziki is perfect.  No complaints there.  

Unfortunately, the hand-cut fries are terrible.  The first time I ordered them I thought I just caught them at a bad time.  But the second time they tasted exactly the same:  like little pieces of soggy, limp cardboard sprinkled with some oregano and a hint of lemon.    

Hand-cut fries take commitment and time to prepare.  After cutting they need to be soaked for hours otherwise they will be limp and soggy.  Then you've got to fry them twice... once after removing from the water and again when they are ordered.  

If you're not up to the task to prepare hand-cut fries properly just serve a good quality frozen fry and stick to what you're good at.

Lost a dedicated customs today. My aunt ordered food for me brought it home and it  was wrong when I called to tell them...the manager was so rude.  No problem I love the food but I won't come back.   She raves about the place...can't deal with attitude

Restaurant motto of their Greek Food, fast, fresh, delicious seems to fit the bill of fare.
My dining  mate and I ordered the traditional Greek Salad with  added felafel. Tzadiki sauce was offered at 50 cents additional . Salads came in full or side salad sizes, $6.95/ $3.95
 Proteins are $3-$4  additional.  The menu also featured gyros, pitas, side items as spinach pie, grape leaves, hummus, kids menu and sweets such as baklava, fried honey balls, custard dessert encased in phyllo etc.
 Lamb or Angus burgers on the menu too and  menu prices reasonable.
The pita bread that came with our salad was soft, warm and fresh and obviously not microwave?d  as it remained soft.
The felafel were good, crunchIy on the outside but a bit dry inside  in our opinion. All the vegetable salad  ingredients were fresh and tasty.
One ordered at the counter, and food brought to the table.
The restaurant appeared clean and neat but decor a bit bland.
The staff seemed friendly and attentive. I would return and try another menu item. My dining mate had eaten there before, said his chicken gyro was very tasty but surprisingly  small

Greco is our go-to place when we need a great salad and a glass of wine. The food is great (salad's, Gyro's and platter) and the atmosphere is nice. Overall a great place with food that is much better than Shomars and Zoes Kitchen in Rivergate.
First of all, the staff here is amazing! They accommodated our big group nicely.  Food was also good, a nice change for the Fort Mill/Tega Cay area. Will definitely be back :)

Today my friend, Virginia, and I decided to try this little Greek spot on the corner of Rea and Colony.  It was light and bright and had a friendly staff of people.  My chicken kabob and hand cut fries came in a blue plastic basket, almost what you would expect to find in a fish camp.  At best, the food was very average.  The chicken was a bit chewy and the fries were heavily salted and greasy.  I guess some would say that's how fries SHOULD BE!   Although I didn't try the hummus, they were offering a lot of different flavors that looked very appetizing.  One in particular was the chipotle hummus.  I probably should have substituted that instead of the fries.   It's always harder to make a food selection while you're standing at a counter and trying to order. I prefer a sit down place with a menu and a server.    Competition is becoming really robust in Charlotte with Mediterranean food.   There seems to be one of these restaurants on every corner now.  With Yafo, Cava, and the Jasmine Grill  setting very high standards, smaller places like this really need to step it up to stay in the game.  I suspect they have a loyal following, based on their neighborhood location.  And, I salute them for bringing something other than than another ho hum burger joint or chain restaurant to this part of town.

Delicious Lamb gyros! I wish they automatically put romaine lettuce on them.  They put feta on it but not romaine lettuce which most place is vice versa.  The lamb is super tender and seasoned well.  The oregano and cumin french fry seasoning is good.  The lemon and garlic fry juice is tasty and bring out ketchup well.  Conveniently located in a shopping center.  My second drop in and it's consistently good. Love the sweet tea.

Having driven out to Ballantyne to visit the proprietor's brothers Greco Fresh Grille, we are super excited that they were able to find a location to open here in Tega Cay!!!

Large menu of authentic Greek food, priced very reasonably and all made, as the name says, FRESH and delicious!

Gonna be a regular!
Liquor license applied for, so beer soon available I assume. #Winning

Yuuuuge fans of this authentic self and delicious place!
Prices are very reasonable.
Very substantial Greek menu, for a small restaurant. 

So glad that they just opened up a location in Tega Cay!
Great food and service.  The falafel pita was flavorful and didn't miss eating meat it was so good.

Every thing was delicious. I have tried Salad,kabobs and Veg pita, the flavor is really great. It's located in big shopping complex, lot of happening area.
Weekend brunch is good to go and relax.

Food was okay but it made me appreciate Showmars.  The floors were greasy and they must have poor ventilation - there was a haze in the air and two days later I put my jacket on and it smells like the place.

Have this place on speed dial. Easy to order by fone, pickup & have a very reasonable, healthy meal. Altho, I do splurge on the lemon-oregano fries sometimes!
Their portions are great....not 2-3 strips of chicken in the wrap....much more and only $6!
Always fresh!

I have celiac disease and the cooks cleaned the grill before making the lamb to go on my Greek salad. Bravo! I could see them so I had increased confidence. Not sure if the used a fresh spatula and gloves but  no problems so far. The food was good and fresh and their attentiveness was superb. I'll have to teach them more next time around.

Good clean restaurant. You order and pay upfront but they bring you food to the table. The kefte was spiced very nicely and the Greek salad was good. I could use just a little less salt, perhaps next time I shall tell them that when I order
The best place for gyro.I am so addicted to the veggie gyro. I wish this place is next to the place I work. I would go at least three time a week. Everything is great at this place.
The falafel us pretty good. A little too much tzaki, but still good. The fries 6 to very well with it, though. The deserts are fantastic!

We went back yesterday, and it looks like the owner's family may be running it now that the new store has opened and the food quality issues have been addressed.  They did an excellent job and were very friendly.  The food was cooked to order and very fresh.  

I went with the chicken souvlaki and it was delicious.  Perfectly cooked and seasoned.  The fries were fresh and perfect!  My husband still says it is the best gyro in Charlotte.  We are looking forward to going back more regularly.
This is a great place. It's not dance and very casual. The food is delicious. I recommend snacking on the hummus. Treat yourself to a big basket of fries.

Got the chicken platter with cumin garlic fries; added pita bread with chipotle garlic hummus.  Everything was excellent.  The staff was friendly and smiling despite a line out the door. I'll be back.

This restaurant has a VERY family feel. From the second you walk in to the second you leave this spot will be a great experience. They're quick, and efficient, and the food is not sloppy. Prices are reasonable. I tried the falafel there today and Good Gosh it was to die for. Try the lemon zest hummus, and the lemon oregano fries are amazing. YUM!!!! You cant beat the prices for fresh quick REAL Greek food. The manager Nick came up to check on us, he is a very humble guy. Glad to see a great business being successful. Cant wait to go back.

While driving all over Charlotte to buy things for my Halloween costume I stumbled upon this place and decided to give it a shot. 

Walking in, it almost reminds me of a little high school cafeteria (my HS at least lol).
We were greeted by a very nice young lady who promptlytook our order.
(You order your meal at a small little counter while overlooking the grill/cooking area.)

We had an order of hummus w/ pita, chicken gyro with lemon oregano fries, and a greek salad w/ grilled chicken. Everything was delicious. I must say that I'm not a "seasoned" fry type of guy....in fact I HATE when fries have anything on them other than salt...and these fries were very good. 

This was my first time here but I was very happy with the entire experience. If your looking for a quick delicious bite to eat, this is the PERFECT alternative for a fast food joint/quick lunch place.

Solid food for a Solid Price.  I have tried the Chicken Gyro and Falafel now.  Both are solid dishes with a very flavorful Tzatziki sauce. They offer fries with different seasoning.  Both the Cumin Garlic and Lemon Oregano have great taste. 

Seating inside is a little tight, but if the weather is good,  you can sit outside and overlook the Blakeney park.  

I will definitely return.

Super excited that they opened close to my house.  I work closer to their other location and we always stop by to pick up for dinner.  Now that they are closer we are here for Sunday lunch. Delicious, fresh and authentic food.

Went there today and enjoyed a gyro with a side of lemon hummus. The food was flavorful, fresh and filling. The staff was friendly, which is important as well. 

Whenever I wanted a gyro I had to go uptown to Little Village Grill, which is a 5 star. They prepare a great  gyro and the way they season their fries are simply delicious! 

This Greek franchise ( in Fort Mill) is a clear 4 star; we've needed a nice Greek place here. I wish them them much success & we'll will be going there often.
Great food, usually I go to the little village grill in CLT - awesome place but when I don't want to drive to CLT this is the best closer place to go to.

Visiting from Florida for the Carolina Ragnar and we were looking for a close place to eat! This was delicious!!! The owner was so friendly and the food was exactly what we needed after a long day in the car and a long weekend ahead of running! The food was very fresh!
Food is good but they tend to mess up the order. So make sure, you double check your order or you will end up with a $17 bill for lunch.
A great family restaurant. The food was excellent and had great prices. The chicken gyro was delicious as well as the choices of hummus.....

Really good food and generous portions. Attentive service and good family spot for quick meal. 

Will def be back.

Amazing!!!!!!!! I can't seem to really want to order anything else outside of the shrimp pita when I go! Or the fries!!! 
My daughter loves it all. The service is great and the food is fresh, definitely my go to in Blakney!

My wife and I stopped in for lunch today and both were extremely impressed by all aspects of our dining experience. Staff were all friendly and knowledgeable of the menu and offered very informative suggestions where needed.  I had the lamb burger with feta cheese and sea salt fries and my wife had the Greek Salad - both were OUTSTANDING!  The Tzatziki sauce was the best I've ever had.  And you know, when something as basic as Tzatziki sauce (basically a condiment) is noticeably better than all others, it speaks volume of the quality and taste of everything else on the menu.  Greco Fresh Grille is a definite must try!

Stopped here wanting a REAL gyro. So the husband & I met in this tight congested shopping center & walked in this nicely decorated eatery. There is a crisp decor & not overly done. 
The staff is very friendly & helpful. There is a large menu hanging over the open kitchen area. A long counter in front of the cooking are does have s few stools to sit & eat or maybe wait for your take out order. 
The are several small tables & seems to have a nice patio out back that would be a great place for a group. 
At the end of the counter is where you order so after standing & looking up for several minutes we proceed to the register & order lamb gyros & make it a combo for $2.50 for, which gave us a drink & fries. We choose the lemon & oregano fried just for a change of pace! 

We were given our paper drink cups & a number & found a table placed the number card in the stand & waited for just a little bit. Soon a girl brings our meals that are served in plastic diner basket with wax paper lining it. Gave us real silverware wrapped in a napkin.

opened up my gyro and my eyes just were so very wide looking at the massive amount shoved in this pita bread. ive never been given to much meat in one of these before! it was 2 slices (not super thin either!) nicely cooked with just a hint of pink in the center. Tzatziki  sauce fresh and placed on the bottom then a lot of sliced purple onion, some tomato slices and topped with that meat.
the fries were really good, I didnt detect the lemon but hubs said he could sometimes. but the oregano was really nice. served with a small solo cup of ketchup. I think next time I might get some Tzatziki  sauce to dip them in!~

The drinks are a fill it yourself, so if eating in this is nice since you can fill er up before you leave. They had 2 tea urns, but i didnt see which was sweet and which was unsweet so I just went with soda.

my only negatives are that it was a little loud, people trying to talk over the loud greek radio type music/talking over head. also I found it really weird that neither my hubs or myself could get a cell signal in here! (AT&T). strange! we had to check in on yelp once we were done and walked outside.

The service is fantastic! The food cooked freshly as you order and are prepared quickly. I tried the lamb gyro and my friend tried the veggie gyro, both are amazing! This is one of the best mediterranean restaurant I've been to! If anyone has tried their stuffed grape leaves or the orange phyllo dessert let us know how it is!

I first visited Greco's a few days after they opened and I was blown away by the crowds that were already gathering. It didn't take me long to understand the reason for the immediate love that folks were showing - it's because of the great people, the FANTASTIC quality and the unique and interesting menu that you will find at Greco's. 

I've since met owner Nick and his enthusiasm and desire to please his customers is so rare in this area and in these times. He and his family truly work hard to earn the business. I've eaten here at least a dozen times since they opened and the quality has been exceptional every time. 

The shrimp skewer platter is awesome and I could eat a gyro every day for the next month. Nick grills the meat to order every time so it's always fresh and hot. The salads are also very crisp and fresh. 

I plan on working my way through the whole menu and I look forward to visiting Greco's regularly. 

It is so great to have Greco's in Fort Mill and  I recommend them highly.

Everything here is delicious - very flavorful and fresh. The tzatziki sauce here is my favorite so far, and I normally order it on the side with my food even if my dish doesn't come with it. You'll also find friendly employees who keep a clean restaurant which is key in a place like this since it stays pretty busy! The lemon oregano fries are amazing and go great with the gyros. This place is  definitely my favorite Greek restaurant in the area and I'm happy they're expanding towards the South Park area!

My husband had the veggie pita and added shrimp. It was very filling and fresh.  I had the traditional pita with a side salad. Everything was custom made to order and the service was the best I've had in a long time.
Recently visited for the first time.  Food was wonderful and the Tzatziki sauce spot on!

I am new to the neighborhood and was so excited that there was a local owned Mediterranean restaurant near me. I was not disappointed! The falafel was moist and flavorful. The gyro had lots of lamb and great flavor. The Greek salad was enough to share. The baklava was to die for. Seriously my new favorite Greek place.I will be back with froends.

First, let me start by saying the service was great! The owner stepped out from behind the counter to go over the menu with us and made sure we were satisfied until we walked out the door.

The chicken gyro and kefte platter was really tasty. However, the rice could use more seasoning. We will definitely be back!
Really good fries and the pitas are all good. Tastes fresh and prices are very competitive. Good for lunch or dinner and families are accommodated. Staff are friendly. All around great place to eat.
First time here and the food was amazing. The falafel, spinach pie triangle, and their famous lemon- oregano fries were delicious. This is definitely my new Greek restaurant to go to.
So glad they opened in Fort Mill.   The food is great and the staff is very friendly. The salad with grilled chicken is huge and delicious. Love their gyros too. One of my favorite lunch places.

This has to be my new favorite go to spot for Greek food. The employees upfront were amazing. Greeted us right when we walked in and were more than willing to answer any questions we had about the menu. The food was absolutely delicious! Very warm and fresh. Will definitely be coming back!

Was really excited to see mostly good reviews. But they don't answer phones and apparently they could care less about being open during their posted hours of operation. Even tried going in person to show up to locked doors hours before closing. If you can't actually be open during your own posted hours you should not own a business. Very very verrrrry poorly ran establishment.

Great Mediterranean food. Glad to have a local place. Humus is tasty and salads were good. Will defiantly come back as we are fans. Not the best Mediterranean food, but still worth the time and effort and portions were adequate but seemed a bit small for the price.

It was just ok. Very skimpy with meat portions. Daughter got shrimp platter, I got chicken platter and hubby got lamb platter. Greek salad was disappointing. Feta cheese was terrible. Consistency of tofu with feta flavoring.  Green peppers in Greek salad?  Never!!!!  But they did. Lamb was gristly and chicken was dry. Shrimp was good but overall meat portions very small for the hefty price. Won't go back.

Excellent service and delicious food. I went there and had the classic gyro all the way and a order of Baklava.
Had a nice time speaking with the manager and shared some stories. Really excellent place, highly recommend it!

WOW WOW WOW!!!  This little hole in the wall is amazing!!  My best friends when I was a child were Orthodox Greek straight from the islands and one of my best friends now is Greek and she and her Mother make AWESOME Greek food.   With all of that being said, I'm a major Greek food snob and I have unreasonably high standards, as a result.  I have been to dozens of Greek restaurants over the years and a handful from Charlotte, NC to Columbia, SC and, hands-down...Greco is far superior to any other that I have been to.  The freshness of the ingredients, the flavors and seasonings, and the quality of the meat is just like my Greek friends have made me accustomed to.

I visited Greco for a late lunch.  Even at 2:00 on a weekday, there were several people in their enjoying their meals and more coming in as I was waiting.  The decor is unpretentious and captures the essence of Greece beautifully.  It has a bit of a Greek Diner feel, which I LOVE!  The service was fast and friendly and I enjoyed watching the chef  (owner, maybe??) prepare my food..."FRESH' is the key word in the title here.  I watched intently and everything was homemade (Tzatziki, Greek dressing, Lamb patties, etc).

I ordered the Lamb Gyro combo with Lemon and Oregano Fries and a Peasant Salad.  The lamb patties for the Gyro are made onsite with fresh lamb and the most perfect Greek Lamb seasoning blend.  It's cooked on the grill-top to order (not made from greasy pre-fab mounds kept warm on a a spit).  This is real deal!!  The meat was moist, tender, and delicious!  It was served with housemade Tzatziki and tomato on a warm pita (I asked them to hold the onions).  The Tzatziki is made with yogurt, fresh shredded cucumbers, fresh herbs, and TONS of garlic....it's a flavor sensation!   The fries...OMG, the fries!!!  The most incredible seasoned fries I have ever tasted.  Tastes like traditional Greek Potatoes, but in french fry form (brilliant marketing move, BTW...everyone loves french fries!!).  French fries are fresh cut with skins, fried crispy on the outside and fluffy in the middle and then they are tossed in a bowl with salt, lemon juice, and oregano.  I will have dreams about these fries!  LOL   Last, but not least, is the Peasant Salad.  The Peasant Salad is everything that you love about a traditional Greek salad, minus the lettuce.  Giant wedges of plump red tomatoes, thinly sliced red onion, sliced seedless cucumbers (with the skin on), Kalamata Olives, and big cubes of deliciously salty and tangy feta cheese.  Again, all of the ingredients are put into a bowl and hand-tossed with Greek dressing and an extra dash of seasoning.  Salad is served with warm pita wedges.   It was a fantastic salad and the serving was huge!  Salads can also be topped with their house-marinated Chicken or Shrimp or their yummy Lamb.  They also have a Vegetarian Pita made with Red Peppers, Eggplant, and Zucchini and a kids menu.  They also offer Whole Wheat Pitas for a mere .25 charge.

Prices are excellent as well.  I paid $15.00 (Gyro combo with Fries and a Drink and a full-sized Peasant Salad) and I made two meals out of it!  BTW, the Fries reheat perfectly in the oven!  

If you are looking for heavy Greek dishes such as Pasticio, Baked Fish, or Leg of Lamb, this isn't the place.  If you are looking for delicious Greek quick dishes, this is a must-try!

I can't wait to go back with my husband....he is going to love it!!!   I must try the Spanikopita next time!

I have a new favorite lunch place!!

Update Oct 8, 2012: I have been back 3-4 times since my original review and the 5-star rating still stands!  The service is always excellent and the ingredients are always very fresh.  My Husband, Son, and Mother have also eaten here with me and they love it, too.  I truly can't say enough about the house-made Gyro meat...it is moist and perfectly seasoned every time!   We have also tried the Spanikopita and it is very good, too!  This is "the" place for Gyros!

The owner is great and super friendly. Most of the food is excellent, and the baklava is great. My only complaints are the lack of healthy options (a lot of fried food) and the Falafel is usually really dry.

Seriously amazing food!! You won't be disappointed!! I had the shrimp kebabs and my husband had the beef gyro! Let's just say we are both satisfied, and we will definitely be back for more!! Super happy they will have mousaka on the menu next week!! I love me some authentic Greek food!!

Greco Fresh Grille is great. We always walked by and considered trying it out but never did until a friend told me they serve the best gyros she's ever had. Great recommendation! We love this place now. I always order a gyro, either chicken or falafel. The chicken is delicious, very simply prepared with tzatziki, tomato, lettuce and red onions, but still flavorful. The falafel is good, too. Sometimes a bit under-seasoned, but still good. My husband prefers the burger. It's seasoned well and you can add American, mozzarella or feta cheese. They have seasoned french fries, too. We like them all: lemon-oregano, cumin and garlic and, plain with sea salt. Their hummus is delicious too. The flavors change weekly, my favorite is probably the rosemary hummus. The restaurant itself is small but comfortable. It's in a great location within Blakeney. The staff is awesome. They're so nice and you can tell they take pride in what they do. Gréco Fresh Grille is a great, quick Mediterranean restaurant.

Didn't even have garlic sauce, ordered the platter, meat was good but in short supply, rice was good, meal came with pita bread but no hummus, it has to ordered on the side for like 4 bucks, weak, you can do better

I don't get down to Blakeney often - in fact, it seems like one of the last times I was here was for this very location, though I'm pretty certain it was a different business then. Regardless, it looks like Greco Fresh is doing a solid business. In fact, their menu is so enticing it can be a challenge to decide what to order. Staff is friendly and eager to help you decide (though they really just help you get stuff on the table, so you end up with plenty of food, not eliminate choices).

This is perhaps not a stop for a fancy date, and is more similar to a corner deli than a sit-down meal that you will enjoy for some time prior to a big night on the town - not that there is anything wrong with that, of course. Plenty of food, from the appetizer options to the meal and also a good selection of deserts too. Good choices all around. Well worth a visit.

I've been the other locations but I'm glad this one opened up because it's close to my work. We got several items here to go and we were all pleased! I was surprised at how the presentations looked in the to go boxes. It was all a nice touch. 

I got the shrimp kabobs with rice. I couldn't believe how much rice they gave me. Shrimp was delicious and tender. Several people for the chicken gyro and loved it. Two people got salads with salmon on it and thought the salmon was cooked well. 

Can't wait to come back! Prices are also very reasonable!

This restaurant is located in the Blakeney area. We got a good parking space and came on a saturday for lunch. They weren't busy at all. Restaurant isn't large but a little narrow. Cashier answered all our questions and was very sweet.

I got the shrimp pita sandwich and spicy fries. Shrimp was delicious and cooked perfectly. The only thing I would ask for is extra red onions. Tatziki sauce went well with it. Spicy fries were good but had a lot of seasoning on it. Some people might like that, but I rather have them lightly seasoned. They also had other flavors of fries. My husband got the chicken pita sandwich and a greek salad. Salad was very fresh. Chicken was good. Very filling. Came with a lot of meat. Both of our meals came with drinks and after our 20% off coupon, it was only $18. 

I would definitely come back!

Great eats here. My wife had the gyro with a side of garlic fries and I had the seasoned chicken kebabs with the lemon-oregano fries. Our tastebuds exploded. Period. The lamb in the gyro is so delectably tender and well seasoned that nothing even comes close...anywhere. We're from NYC and have had a good gyro here and there but this really kicks butt. Not to be outshined were the kebabs. Seasoned to perfection and moist! The portions and price are just right. We've been here before but we continue to come back because of the consistency of service and food. 
The owner, by the way, is a rare guy indeed. In a world where the dollar is what motivates us all, this man has has a passion for his food and it shows.

Give this place a try and you won't be sorry. There are some businesses I'd like to see stick around and be successful and this is one of them.

The lamb gyro was good. French fries were under seasoned but cooked very well. My daughter loved her burger!  I do wish they had a house made, mid eastern style (very) hot sauce. Very nice service. I will probably be eating here at least once a week.  Great job, guys!
This is a nice clean place. Food is good but not great. It satisfies my gyro craving but makes me miss the Greek from Astoria , Queens.

Saw the Now Open banner yesterday and visited today for lunch.  It is right next to a wonderful deli.  Met the owner, Nick, yesterday and seems like a stand up guy.  Today ordered two traditional Gyros and a side of hummus.  Absolutely delicious!  So nice to have another ehtnic food option in Tega Cay!  You need to try this place.  We will be back many times!

I am a major fan of Greco Fresh Grille, I absolutely love the outdoor seating, amazing service, and french fries! This place has amazing vegetarian options and a great comfortable setting. I have been here many times and I will be coming back soon.
Favorite place for lunch, wonderful family owned restaurant, great gyro's and the garlic cumin fries are to die for. Hummus is made fresh daily, this is a can't miss!
Wonderful, fresh and fast! Family friendly. Salmon pita and cumin garlic fries (extra crispy) are my favorites

This is a brand new establishment be as expected the crowd flood it at least for lunch. It was crowded. They have a number system that you place on your table and a server comes and delivers your food but you pay prior to like you would at a fast food place. The food is mediocre at best for Greek. The fries were over salted and the meat is not bursting with flavor. The value is not there for $11 my platter was not delicious me I would not count on coming back. Staff is friendly but seems overwhelmed.

The best french fries in Charlotte.  Period.  These are delicious fresh cut seasoned fries that are french fry perfection.  I have had the lemon & oregano and the cumin & garlic and both are excellent.  I enjoy the shrimp pita and the veggie pita.  Both have creamy delicious sauce and fresh purple onion slices wrapped in a warm soft pita bread wrap.  Employees are friendly and helpful.
I am ECSTATIC that Greco has come to Tega Cay!!!! I always have the chicken gyro and lemon oregano fries, and they are fantastic. Love the staff, too! Very genuine, nice people.
Love their baklava. The queen makes it. The owner and his daughter are very nice people too--they run the joint.

Wow. I wish I had eaten here sooner. The customer service is wonderful.  Nick offered me a military discount & told me to thank my father for his service. He also gave me wonderful menu suggestions. 

I ordered the chicken gyro & a side of grape leaves. I dined outside.
Note: this is a perfect lunch spot if you have children. You can watch them play while you eat. 

The food & customer service was awesome. I'll be back!
Go elsewhere for Greek food in south Charlotte. Both the kefte and chicken were extremely dry and the hummus lacked any flavor. Very disappointed in the quality of the food and will not be returning.

Love this little Greek spot.  Most days you'll find the owner, Nick, running the register.  Nick is super friendly and always generates a conversation with his customers.  Actually the entire customer experience is great as everyone here is really nice. 

The food is consistently great.  I have tried several items, but my go to is the Mezze Platter which includes spinach pies, dolmades, tzatziki, feta, olives, hummus, cucumbers and pita.  Only $8.95 for all this!!

For the gluten allergy people, any sandwich on the menu can be made into a lettuce wrap.  Also pita pizza, burger or chicken fingers for the little ones that may not like the regular menu. 

This place easily gets and deserves 5 stars.

Food is fresh and delicious.  Varied menu.  Family owned. Have been in about a half dozen times and food is always consistently excellent, as well as the customer service.  Good value.  New and always very clean.

It's really great to have a place like this nearby. It's right up the road and easy to find and the food is great.
My wife and I moved here from San Francisco a number of years ago and have been waiting for great food places to open. 
It looks like our wishes are finally coming true.

Fast food atmosphere - but quite possible one of the BEST Greek Gyros in all of South Charlotte. The owner is authentic Greek descandant and they were playing Greek radio (Pandora) while we ate. 

Very authentic, and large, generous portions of sliced meat.

I live close to this fantastic Mediterranean gem.  I get takeout and eat in at least twice a week when I am not traveling.  I have never had a bad meal in the last 3 years.  In fact, when I am out of town I crave their Greek salad and tzatziki sauce.  I have a good friend who recently moved his office and can't get there for lunch any longer, and it is one one thing he said he misses the most.  My girl friend loves their veggie pita and fries.    The staff is very friendly and always smiling, especially Mia, Blake, and Michelle.  Although the place is small it is always very clean.   Craving it!  Heading over for dinner right now!!

Would go out of our way to go to the Blakeney location before they built one closer to us. Family owned with very friendly staff! The lemon oregano fries are out of this world. Also, love that they offer a wheat pita option.
I like this place. It's clean, the food is good and has  reasonable price. Their platter and buklava is my fav.
The atmosphere is awesome! Owners and workers are super friendly. The food was awesome! Definitely going for the traditional gyro next time! Get the lemon fries

I try and give this place another try but every time
It disappoints. I just ordered a to go meal and I get home and the fries were literally raw- like the potato.. and my chicken was raw as well. Threw it all away. Will not be returning and will tell others to not go here as well.

My wife and I heard really good things about Greco's other restaurants so I decided to pick up dinner last Saturday. It was great! I got the traditional gyro and the Mrs. got the Greek salad with chicken. The meats were well seasoned, the tzatziki was home made and tasted great! Their stuffed grape leaves and hummus were really good, too. Thrilled to have another great restaurant to add to our Saturday night options! You can probably tell from the other reviewers pictures that it's more of a "counter service" place. Inside is nice, no frills. A little small. It's in a strip mall. Has outside seating. I decided not to take off any stars for the layout. It's not their fault. Food is great, that's all that matters!

Well, I decided to give this another shot. I came in for lunch and went with a gyro and oregano fries. I was much more impressed this time. I felt the quality of the food was much more in line with what I was paying, and if I recall correctly, the inside of the restaurant has been improved. The oregano fries are a nice change, but I do think they go a tad heavy on the oregano. I thought the service was much better this go around. After my visit, I feel like I'll come back to this place more frequently.

This place is a hidden gem! Love the chick pea salad with salmon! Arugula is fresh and the tastiest lemon dressing. Oh! the fries with rosemary and lemon are to die for. We are there at least once a week if not more! My favorite restaurant at Blakeney.

Absolutely the best Gyro you can get around! Coming from New Jersey, I've tried many Greek places in the NY/NJ area. Never have I tried a place as authentic and as delicious as Greco Fresh Grille! Employees are friendly, place looks great, and food is the best! I had the lamb gyro, Greek fries, lemon rosemary hummus, and peasant salad. All fantastic choices! Highly recommend!

This restaurant is located in the Blaneney shopping center, close to 5 Guys.  Parking is very tight in this corner of the shopping center -okay, parking is tight in the ENTIRE shopping center- so you will likely be parking a little ways from the restaurant.  The resturant is layed out a little oddly, so you are literally standing on top of the menu while you look at it. There is a nice back patio you can sit on that is close to the Blakeney Fountain.  

The food came out quick and was delicious. Their Chicken Gyro was delicious.  They offer many different seasoning options for your fries, which I will definitely try the next time I am in. I really wish the girl taking my order had asked which I wanted, because I didn't even see the options until after I had ordered.

This was my first time eating at Greco Fresh Grille, though I had been wanting to go for over a year! The food is as fresh as can be. I ordered the falafel pita wrap and spicy fries. The falafel was amazing - crispy on the outside and moist on the inside. There is a generous amount of falafel in the wrap. The dressing (tzatziki, I think) inside the pita was delicious. I will definitely be back. Spicy fries were the best I've had in a while. I am so glad they opened a restaurant close to South Park!

Just had our first experience at Greco and the food was to die for! The chicken kabobs, fries, and baklava were delicious. Not to mention the very attentive and kind staff. We will definitely be returning for excellent Mediterranean food.
Awesome place. Awesome food. Casual place. Fresh food. Great staff. Try Greco fresh today!

DELICIOUS!!!

My wife and I waited almost 6 months before we decided to try this greek place.  I don't know why we waited so long but it still pains me to think of all those months I missed of spectacular greek food less than two miles away in Blakeney.  

Growing up in the Greek Orthodox church, being a foodie, and spending our honeymoon in Greece, I am very picky about my greek food from the quality of the meats, to the tzatziki sauce and pitas, to the salads, and the dressings.

My ultimate favorite dish they serve is the lamb gyro.  The meat is by FAR the best in town.  Hot, flavorful, and with just the right amount of tzatziki and olive oil...mmm, my mouth is watering now.  DO NOT overlook having fries with your gyro!  So many greek places have those fat, undercooked, unflavorful fries that I CAN'T stand!  Not here.  The Greco Fresh fries are hand cut, served hot, and if you want, drizzled with lemon juice and topped with oregano, that's right, superb! (I like mine with tzatziki sauce for dipping).   

My wife loves the peasant salad which I always have to help her finish.  If you're not familiar with a peasant salad, it's just the good stuff, no lettuce filler.  Think fresh cucumbers, green peppers, onions (if you want), tomatoes, olives, lots of feta, and of course, their delicious house made dressing.  You can't go wrong with this salad.  This is the way salad should be, why waste space with lettuce that has no taste.  

One word of caution, the homemade tzatziki sauce stays on the breath for a while if you eat as much as I do so come packing a few pieces of gum for after your meal, especially if going back to work.

They also have Cheerwine on tap which is the shizzle if you are a true born and raised North Carolinian.  

The customer service there is top notch, probably the best in Ballantyne, and the owner always walks around if he has time and talks and jokes with his customers.

The one comment about the "greek" guy who was angry about the baklava being store bought obviously needs to have his greek cred checked.  Maybe it didn't taste like your mommas but it is definitely not from any store. Not only are the desserts baked in house, the owner's wife makes them which is why they sometimes don't have galaktoboureko, doesn't get more small business greek than that.

With that being said, go eat at Greco Fresh and enjoy!  Maybe you'll see us there tonight as well...
Fast, friendly and delicious. The place is great. The gyros are fresh and this place is becoming my new go to place for Greek food.

Gyro pita was good but too small, could have eaten two whereas at Showmars one fills me up.  Gyro meat not shaved....but preformed patties.  Fries were overdone and tasted burnt...but they weren't....which is odd.  Dining room kinda small and cramped......slightly pricey for what you get.  One trash can by the register....hard to clear your own table.  Casual atmosphere makes you think "Five Guys of Greek food".

This is our go to restaurant after church every Sunday!  We are addicted to their home made baklava ... The best I've ever had!!  And the shrimp pita is my favorite, take it outside and enjoy the gorgeous weather!  The staff is super friendly also!

This was the best Greek place I have been to in Charlotte. I loved that it was clean and quiet and how fast the food came. I had the Mezze platter to try something different and I was impressed with how good & fresh everything looked and tasted. the spinach pies were off the hook. This is a must if you swing by the Colony Rd area. I will definitely be back.
Wonderful food and pleasant staff! Highly recommend the chicken gyro and fries. Consistent too, prolly been 10 times over the years.
This place is awesome.  Super fresh - authentic food.  Imagine that!!  Owner is wonderful!

Stopped by for a lunch and the place was pretty packed for lunch time. We ordered gyro platter and special platter. Special platter comes with choice of meat, salad and rice or fries. The platter of lamb was pretty good. It is a good deal of the meal. Tzatziki sauce and the fries were good and the food is fresh there! Enjoyed the meal. FYI, the place is self service and tables are limited. But  there are outdoor seatings so you can enjoy when the weather is good.
Wonderful lunch spot. Delicious food & friendly employees. Falafel was so good!! Love how bright and cheerful the décor is. Will definitely be frequenting this spot!
I love this place. The chicken gyro is amazing and extremely well priced. The Greek family that owns the place are so nice and welcoming. You feel like you are eating at their place.
By far one of the best places to eat st. Great food, great owners and great prices....win, win all around. Best Greek I've had in Charlotte!

Lamb gyro and the "lemon and oregano" fries. Fresh hot and tasty.  Was a little louder than what we like, but no issues even with several children in the restaurant. I would like to see them rearrange the drink and condiments area as it is a bit cluttered and so close to the table across from it you almost bump into them if they are seated there. I think they have wi-fi if you need it. Great Greek food without waiting for the Greek festival. We will return on a regular basis.

Great food, don't waste anymore time looking for good Greek food. It is right here!!!
Great service and customer care.
Really good food, really good service!! We have always ordered the gyros.  We have liked them all.  The kids meals are great too.

3 words....Lemon.Rosemary.Hummus.  

GAME CHANGER!  Best hummus I have had in Charlotte.  I don't know how or why but this hummus is on point!!!  They could be adding gasoline for all I know and I wouldn't even care.  The consistency is perfect, the flavor mixture is spot on, the pita bread served with it is warm and fresh.  Yummm...what a treat.  They offer other flavors of hummus as well including Chipolte and traditional.  I'm sure they are great.  

The greek salad was very good and the dessert we ordered was phenomenal!!  I don't know the real greek word and I am too lazy to look it up but it was some type of custard in a phyllo dough, baked, warm and ridiculously good.  It was big enough to share but I could have housed the whole thing on my own with no problem.  

The place is not much to look at and the Blakeney location is sandwiched inbetween Brixx and Cold Stone so it gets a bit lost and a bit crazy on the weekends.  They can't really seat more than a table of 4 inside but they have a small outdoor patio.  Word on the street is they have another location...I think they said Stallings?  Somewhere out there.  Anyway, love them.  Far from where I live but worth the trip.  I need to try a few more things but this may be my go-to for Greek moving forward.

The chicken gyro was awesome! The chicken is seasoned to perfection, with thinly sliced onions, tomatoes, tzatziki on a warm gyro! I chose a side salad which was just as great, lettuce, tomatoes, olives, feta, onions & an amazing homemade dressing! Love it!!!

My wife heard about this place opening recently and being lovers of all things Gyro we gave it a shot over the Holidays. It was awesome! Friendly staff and great fresh made hummus, salads, etc....All for a fair price. The lemon dill hummus and Parmesan oregano fries were excellent. So much so, we ended up going back three days later to try a few more selections. Better still our boys loved it, too, so now we have a new family dinning venue right around the corner.
Deliciously prepared! Service was prompt and courteous. I would highly recommend this for fresh Greek food!

Stopped in for a fresh gyro and it was excellent. I had a seat at the bar where I could see into the kitchen and watch the magic happen. Very clean, very efficient organized process going on here.

My gyro didn't take long to be cooked and assembled. Nice thick pieces of lamb and the tzatziki was excellent. Only slightly messy, which it's kind of supposed to be. Delicious!

Cute little restaurant. Not quite first date material but certainly great for a meet up.
Good solid fresh food and hearty portions .Reasonable prices and nice variety. They owned a diner in North Jersey. Family owned . They know what they are doing .

This place has the best gyro I've had in Charlotte, and one of the best I've had anywhere. The food is consistently good, obviously fresh, and the owners are very friendly. The prices are great, too. My wife and I make at least a couple trips a month.
You have to try their food! Absolutely delicious! Ive had their salmon, shrimp, chicken, lamb, and even vegetarian dishes. All perfectly seasoned!!

Let's begin with a confession: I don't like gyros. Feta cheese? Pass. You know what changed my mind? This place. I now eat here or get takeout once a week because everything is fresh, delicious, well-prepared. I love GFG. The cumin-garlic fries are like, whoa fries calm down! Try them. try everything. TRY IT!!!

It's nice to find a place that will make your order the way you want. Everything I get has to be changed in someway (just a picky eater) but the staff here does so and always with a smile. The owner always engages me when he takes my order and really makes you feel good about your day. If that wasn't enough, the food is terrific. Good home style Greek favorites. Cooked just right with the perfect amount of seasoning. I highly recommend them for Lunch and dinner.
Delicious!!!! We had the traditional gyro's and lemon oregano fries. For dessert we had their baklava. All of it...the bomb dot com. Coming from a Greek food lover. :)

CHECK THE MENU PRICES AND YOUR ORDER TOTAL BEFORE YOU PAY!!!

Ok, I just had to get that out before I start my review. I went to Greco a little after the lunch time rush after seeing the awesome reviews on Yelp. When I walked in only a couple of tables were seated. I reviewed the huge menu posted and proceeded to the register to place my ToGo order. I knew that I wanted the Platter, but I wasn't quite sure which meat I wanted. I had a taste for some beef so I asked if they offered Steak or Beef, he said no. I then asked what Kefte and falafel were (I don't have much Greek cuisine experience), he said Kefte was a beef patty *blank stare* sir can I have the Kefte platter please!! I ordered it with Lemon Oregano fries and the Greek Salad that the menu says it comes with. Kind of irritated I handed him my card not even paying attention to the cost. I sat down to sign the receipt and noticed it had a total of $16.28!! Now WAYMENT!!! I know that menu says $9.95 for Kefte! I checked the board and the printed menu before bringing it to his attention. He then tries to tell me that the platter doesn't come with Kefte and that he instead charged me for Grilled Kefte and added a salad since it doesn't come with one. But err-uhhh the menu clearly lists Kefte as an option for the platter. We walked over to the board TWICE as he continued to argue with me about it. He then eventually says, ok the platter costs more with Kefte and it'll be $10.95 before tax. At this point I just looked at him totally confused. He then comes back and says ok i'll charge you $10.95 and give you $1 in cash and you pay the $9.95. I ended up paying $10.96 with that credit in cash. 

When I got back to the office I was completely underwhelmed. The Salad, was just SAD! Just looking at it didn't have me at all excited to eat it. That's all I have for that, ended up rotting in my fridge. The Kefte was just ok. The beef with dry and tough. The fries were soft and lacked flavor. Probably needed salt. I tasted a hint of Lemon here and there but other than that, nothing. The best part of the meal with the Pita Wedges. I ate all of those. I'm not sure if it was because I ordered Togo, or maybe they gave me lackluster food because I demanded I be charged the correct price, but my food was not as good as the reviews rave about.

I now see a few people note that their meal price seemed to come out higher than the menu. And i'm telling you that this is not just a coincidence! I'll definitely not be returning again, but if you go, check prices before you pay because they are as crooked as they come!!

Amazing everything.  I have never been disappointed or left feeling hungry.  Great food, nice staff, always a pleasure. 

Also....REALLY Good food.

Really solid spot for casual Greek in Blakeney.  I've tried both the chicken and lamb gyros, and both are quite yummy.  I appreciate having the option for whole wheat pita, even with the 25 cent upcharge.  Have tried both types of fries, lemon oregano and garlic cumin, and while they're sure to make any fry lover happy, I didn't find them particularly spectacular.  I prefer to opt for their hummus, with an interesting rotation of flavors, having tried the chipotle hummus which was good.  Prices are very reasonable, with pitas going for $6, with an extra $3 to make it a combo with fries or hummus and a drink.  Highly recommend for a quick lunch if you find yourself in the area.

Excellent!! So delicious!!! I had the Greek salad, super FRESH! The dressing is wonderful!! My daughter had a chicken gyro and my husband had the beef gyro.  Both excellent!! So so happy to have excellent Greek food in Tega Cay/Fort Mill!
This place is great.  Awesome gyros and great atmosphere.  My favorite is the fries.  They are great fries without the added spices.  The added spices make them unique.

I visited Greco for the first time today. I am a fan of Greek food and this place exceeded my expectations. The menu items were very fresh and the food was full of flavor. Their are a variety of options for the fries and combinations for the meal. I would also like add that the service was great. As a first timer I was provided with recommendations which turned out to be great suggestions. If you are ever in the area and looking for a place to eat I would strongly recommend Greco.
